quadratix.simulatedannealing

Class SimulatedAnnealing<P,R extends java.lang.Number>

  • java.lang.Object
    • quadratix.simulatedannealing.SimulatedAnnealing<P,R>
  • Type Parameters:
    P - Denotes the parameter type of the fitness function, that can be any elements (bits, combination, number, ...).
    R - represents the return type of the fitness function. It is often a number (integer or real).
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ISearch<P,R>

    public class SimulatedAnnealing<P,R extends java.lang.Number>
extends java.lang.Object
implements ISearch<P,R>
    Class that implements the simulated annealing

      • SimulatedAnnealing

        public SimulatedAnnealing()
        Default constructor. The default values are : * t0 = 1 n1 = 10 n2 = 10 mu = 0.5

    • Method Detail

      • search

        @Nullable
public P search(@NotNull
                           @NotNull java.util.function.Function<P,R> f,
                           P x0,
                           @NotNull
                           @NotNull java.util.function.Function<P,java.util.HashMap<P,ElementaryFunction<P>>> V,
                           @NotNull
                           @NotNull NumberOperations<R> rOperation)
        Search the optimal point in a space of solutions.
        Specified by:
        search in interface ISearch<P,R extends java.lang.Number>
        Parameters:
        f - The fitness function.
        x0 - The starting point.
        V - A function that maps an element `P` to a list of neighbors associated with their function to find it (x -> x'), and the invert function (x' -> x).
        rOperation - The operations we can apply on `R`.
        Returns:
        Return the optimal point if found.

      • search

        @Nullable
public P search(@NotNull
                           @NotNull java.util.function.Function<P,R> f,
                           P x0,
                           @NotNull
                           @NotNull java.util.function.Function<P,java.util.HashMap<P,ElementaryFunction<P>>> V,
                           @NotNull
                           @NotNull NumberOperations<R> rOperation,
                           double t0,
                           int n1,
                           int n2,
                           double mu)
        Search the optimal point in a space of solutions.
        Parameters:
        f - The fitness function.
        x0 - The starting point.
        V - A function that maps an element `P` to a list of neighbors associated with their function to find it (x -> x'), and the invert function (x' -> x).
        rOperation - The operations we can apply on `R`.
        t0 - Initial temperature
        n1 - Maximum number of iteration for first loop.
        n2 - Maximum number of iteration for second loop.
        mu - Factor to decrease temperature at each iteration.
        Returns:
        Return the optimal point if found.

      • computeTemperature

        public static <P,R> double computeTemperature(@NotNull
                                              @NotNull java.util.function.Function<P,R> f,
                                              @NotNull
                                              @NotNull java.util.function.Function<P,java.util.HashMap<P,ElementaryFunction<P>>> V,
                                              @NotNull
                                              @NotNull NumberOperations<R> rOperation,
                                              @NotNull
                                              @NotNull java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Void,P> randomGenerator,
                                              @NotNull
                                              @NotNull java.util.function.Function<R,java.lang.Double> rToDouble,
                                              int nbIteration)
        Compute an approximation of the most optimal initial temperature t0.
        Type Parameters:
        P - Denotes the parameter type of the fitness function, that can be any elements (bits, combination, number, ...).
        R - represents the return type of the fitness function. It is often a number (integer or real).
        Parameters:
        f - The fitness function.
        V - A function that maps an element `P` to a list of neighbors associated with their function to find it (x -> x'), and the invert function (x' -> x).
        rOperation - The operations we can apply on `R`.
        randomGenerator - A function that return a random element of `P` at each call.
        rToDouble - A function that convert an element of type `R` to a real number (double).
        nbIteration - Number of iterations. The larger, the more accurate the computation will be.
        Returns:
        Return t0.
        See Also:
        search(Function, Object, Function, NumberOperations, double, int, int, double), Stream, Stream.mapToDouble(ToDoubleFunction), DoubleStream, DoubleStream.average()
